image.altText: Medics prepare premature babies for transport to Egypt after they were evacuated from hosptal in Gaza City.

props.synopsis: The UN is investigating whether the "rules of war" have been broken by Israel and Hamas. But what qualifies as a war crime?

title.children: Hamas and Israel are both alleged to have broken the 'rules of war' — what are they?

image.altText: a young woman in a white top speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: In the mid 2000s, Tina Chou was a bubbly pop star on her way to the top. Almost two decades on, she has joined the growing chorus of women speaking up as the MeToo movement sweeps across Taiwan.

title.children: A Taiwanese pop star accused a powerful man of sexual harassment. Then he sued her

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks annoyed as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: The PM is finishing the year with a sullen electorate that can't really see past the economic pain it is feeling, and national security back in the realm of talk about border security and terrorists, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: A sullen electorate, an opponent with lethal populism and unanswered questions: Can Albanese regain control in 2024?

image.altText: A Christmas tree is seen on a windy and rainy Bondi Beach in Sydney

props.synopsis: Violent thunderstorms are likely across eastern Australia this Christmas, rivalling some of the most intense and widespread storm outbreaks of the past few decades.

title.children: Explosive thunderstorms likely from Mackay to Melbourne this Christmas

image.altText: A chinese aircraft

props.synopsis: The news sparked controversy in the island, with think tank Taiwan Economic Democracy Union warning authorities to investigate suspicions of election bribery and political interference.

title.children: Flying high or low? The surprising role of airfares in shaping Taiwan's election

image.altText: Linda Thomas-Greenfield sits at a desk, flanked by others, with a folder of documents, microphone and a 'United States' sign

props.synopsis: After days of delays, the UN Security Council adopts a watered-down resolution urging faster aid supplies for Gaza — but a call for an "urgent suspension of hostilities" is dropped to avoid another American veto.

title.children: UN Security Council passes Gaza aid resolution, avoiding veto as US and Russia abstain

image.altText: A young couple is handed a set of silver house keys.

props.synopsis: It's now common knowledge that loans and gifts from family are a large part of breaking into the housing market. But how is parental financial support being used in other areas?

title.children: The 'bank of mum and dad' is covering more than housing as young Australians flounder in tough economy

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie in a mirror.

props.synopsis: Jacinta Davila, who had been co-accused of murdering prominent Adelaide doctor Michael Yung during an alleged home invasion, has been granted home-detention bail.

title.children: Woman co-accused of killing top Adelaide doctor has murder charge against her dropped

image.altText: Red fire retardant being dropped from a plane.

props.synopsis: Two fires which threatened lives and homes on the outskirts of Perth are now contained.

title.children: Firefighters contain two major bushfires in Perth after relentless 48 hours of emergencies

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann and Brittany Higgins at The Dock

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's barrister tells the Federal Court it cannot rely at all on the evidence of Brittany Higgins, as he makes his closing arguments in the defamation case brought by the former Liberal staffer.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer questions Brittany Higgins's credibility in closing arguments of defamation case

image.altText: An Australian bowler appeals for a wicket in the women's Test against India in Mumbai.

props.synopsis: After a flurry of wickets before tea, Australia went wicketless in the final session on day two of the one-off women's Test match with India finishing 7-376.

title.children: India's women on top after day two of Test against Australia

image.altText: Medical clinic sign, with old cottage ion left and road leading to clinic building on left, trees

props.synopsis: Increasingly priced out of the locum GP market, Streaky Bay's community-run medical clinic often has no doctor, which leaves nursing staff and volunteer ambulance members facing greater workloads.

title.children: Outbid and out-of-pocket, a seaside community wonders where next GP will come from

image.altText: A sand coloured brick town sign has black letters reading 'Tailem Bend' and a black steam train. It is on a country road

props.synopsis: The $425 million Riverbend Energy Hub proposal in Tailem Bend could turn 200,000 tonnes of landfill into green hydrogen every year.

title.children: Australian first green hydrogen project set to boost jobs and reduce emissions

image.altText: Chopper pilot rescued multiple people from flooded areas

props.synopsis: The pilot, who leapt into action to fly a group of people stranded on the roof of the Lion's Den Pub to safety one by one, is being lauded as the "real hero" of the flood rescue efforts.

title.children: Meet 'Magoo', the chopper pilot who saved 16 people from a pub roof in Far North Queensland

image.altText: A woman smiles.

props.synopsis: A man accused of attacking two women – killing one and seriously injuring another – was discharged from the Royal Adelaide Hospital on Monday. He appeared in court and has been remanded in custody.

title.children: Friends mourn mum who'd started 'dream job' as details emerge of suspect's release from hospital before 'random' stabbing

image.altText: Composite image of an accused and a victim.

props.synopsis: Dhirren Randhawa, who is accused of causing the death of Charlie Stevens last month during Schoolies celebrations has asked a magistrate to vary his bail conditions – so he can have contact with his friend, who is a case witness.

title.children: Teen accused of killing SA Police Commissioner's son granted permission to contact witness friend

image.altText: Image of a teenager wearing a white hoodie. He is looking out of frame.

props.synopsis: British teenager Alex Batty, who was found in France after going missing six years ago, has revealed he returned to the UK for a better future.

title.children: British teenager Alex Batty, who was found after going missing six years ago, says he left France for a better future

image.altText: A woman with her hair in a bun and a blue shirt standing outside with her husband.

props.synopsis: A traumatised mother of two has spoken out after a terrifying attack as acts of kindness remind her that Townsville is a caring and wonderful city.

title.children: 'It was beautiful, so unexpected': Melissa gifted a new car after falling victim to harrowing youth crime attack

image.altText: News Quiz thumbnail

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Test your knowledge with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A 'hero' emerges in the floods, shearer sets world record and Neil the seal makes his return

image.altText: Illustration of woman and man sitting on a car bonnet

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old went on a solo cybercrime spree  in 2022 where he targeted Uber, Revolut and threatened to release code from an upcoming Grand Theft Auto sequel.

title.children: Hacker who blackmailed Grand Theft Auto developers sentenced to indefinite hospital detention

image.altText: Sillohuetes of 61 women imposed over the house of representatives.

props.synopsis: The ABC contacted every male MP in the House of Representatives to ask what is being done in their electorates about a family violence crisis that has seen more than 50 women killed this year.

title.children: The ABC contacted every federal male MP about domestic violence deaths. Here's what they said

image.altText: A man, teenage girl and woman at East Timor border.

props.synopsis: From Somerset in England to Sydney in New South Wales, the trio spent four months crammed into buses, boats and trains to get to a sister's wedding, and arrived with days to spare.

title.children: This family spent four months trying to travel from England to Australia without flying, and nearly did it

image.altText: A Bonza aircraft on a runway.

props.synopsis: Outback Queensland residents are in uproar as another round of flight cancellations means families will be separated for Christmas, or forced to pay thousands of dollars for last-minute flights.

title.children: 'Absolutely disgraceful': Sudden Bonza flight cancellations leave outback residents stranded for Christmas

image.altText: Prague university shooting leaves 14 dead

props.synopsis: Footage shows students leaping out building windows in desperation as they flee the lone gunman who killed at least 14 people at Charles University in Czechia.

title.children: Video shows the exact moment students leap out of windows to flee Prague gunman

image.altText: Carl Webb playing for Queensland in 2008.

props.synopsis: The former Queensland and Australian representative, who was diagnosed with motor neurone disease in 2020, died on Thursday night.

title.children: Former State of Origin player Carl Webb dies aged 42

image.altText: A sign on an exterior wall says St Vincent's Hospital Melbourne

props.synopsis: St Vincent's Health says there is evidence that "some data" has been removed from its system, but it is still working to determine what information had been stolen.

title.children: Data stolen in cyber attack on St Vincent's Health network

image.altText: Vin Diesel in a suit.

props.synopsis: Fast and Furious star Vin Diesel has been accused by his former assistant of sexual battery while working for him in 2010.

title.children: Vin Diesel accused of sexual assault by former assistant in lawsuit

image.altText: A photo of someone holding a picture of Jamal Khashoggi with a candle

props.synopsis: The widow of murdered Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi has been granted political asylum more than three years after she first fled to the United States.

title.children: 'They destroyed my life': Widow of murdered journalist Jamal Khashoggi granted asylum

image.altText: A baby swimming towards a dollar bill.

props.synopsis: Spencer Elden's lawsuit alleges that he has suffered "permanent harm" as the band and others profited from the image of him which featured on an album cover.

title.children: Court revives lawsuit against Nirvana over 1991 Nevermind naked baby album cover
